header.title: Royal snub: Meghan Markle to abandon Thanksgiving plans with mum after 'hurting' Queen
header.subtitle: MEGHAN MARKLE was supposed to be spending Thanksgiving in Los Angeles with her mother Doria Ragland, but now the Duchess has reportedly changed her mind and may be staying in the UK after all.
header.postText: 'Sources close to the Duchess of Sussex have confirmed that she might instead spend the day helping out at a homeless shelter in London, according to the MailOnline. The shelter will also be close to her home in Windsor.', 'Meghan and Prince Harry were allegedly supposed to be spending the traditional American holiday in LA with the Duchess’ mother Doria Ragland.', 'However, sources close to the royal have now said the couple are considering having Doria make the 11-hour journey to the UK where she will spend Thanksgiving at Frogmore Cottage with the couple and their seven-month-old son Archie.',  'A royal insider told Mail Online: From what I know, they aren 't coming here [to Los Angeles].', 'Doria is going there for the holiday[Thanksgiving].', 'They won't be officially celebrating Thanksgiving because it isn't a British holiday but Meghan is considering spending some of the day helping out at a homeless shelter in London.', 'It comes as Buckingham Palace confirmed that the couple will not spend Christmas at Sandringham with the Queen so they can recharge their batteries.', 'The Palace said: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are looking forward to extended family time towards the end of this month.', 'The couple have spent the last two Christmas holidays at Sandringham with the royal family. ', 'As a new family, they hope to spend the festive holiday with Doria Ragland. ', 'The Palace added: This decision is in line with precedent set previously by other members of the Royal Family, and has the support of Her Majesty The Queen.', 'The UK does not celebrate Thanksgiving because it is a traditional US holiday that can be traced back to English colonists.', ' The tradition suggests that in 1619, 38 English settlers marked their safe arrival from Virgnia with a feast and Thanksgiving prayers. ', 'A couple of years later, the Pilgrim Fathers in Plymouth, Massachusetts had a celebration and are now the origin of the holiday.', 'Its current date was set by President Franklin D.Roosevelt in order to help businesses and retailers.', 'Meghan’ s celebration of the American holiday will be her first as a mother.', 'The Duchess spent last year’ s holiday at her old home in Kensington Palace where she allegedly made a Thanksgiving meal for her husband Prince Harry.', 'The meal reportedly had traditional components including a turkey.', 'The couple recently made the decision to have a six - week break from royal duties after their recent trip to Africa.', 'Although they did appear at the Remembrance Day ceremonies on Sunday, the couple are not scheduled to attend any other events this year.', 'However, the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have a very busy schedule.', 'Prince William will be taking a four - day trip to Kuwait and Oman at the beginning of next month.', 'Thanksgiving will be held on November 28 in the US.'

Secondly the Queen had within her remit to not grant permission for the marriage. Then if Harry still wanted to proceed with the marriage, he would have to abdicate his title and privileges.

Seems pretty normal, actually. This isn 't news.

The British have a valid right to complain. You obviously don't know the royals are funded by the British taxpayer. The Royals have entered into a contract with the British public so there are duties, responsibilities and OBLIGATIONS that go with that. They are PUBLIC FIGURES who have a limited right to privacy. The trade off is they get to enjoy the perks of Royalty. When the Monarchy is not being transparent and are trying to deceive the Public the British become critical and will call them out for being dishonest. Unless your prepared to pay for them I would zip it!😉🤐
